text:
well HS has shifted a lot of resources toward making it easier to develop locally. This is all old news now, but. FTP works pretty great now, you have full access to the design manager file system minus drag n drop templates.

People have started setting up build processes that can work with it or via the api.

They also updated the local HubL server. (I don’t fully know the scope of changes there. didn’t use the original one much)
no if only they had a connect github rep option for the DM
y’know. squarespace has this. if HubSpot is willing to make the investment I think that would be huge
if you post an idea I’ll upvote

this may help with your question:
(from <@U7V9DQ31P>'s blog) <https://www.kelp.agency/blog/manipulate-HubSpot-forms-with-javascript-the-right-way>
feel free to add comments, I am by no means a GitHub expert though I am going to be getting into this alot more
writing up a lengthy git reasoning

Is there a way to filter search results in the site search input module? We have an events blog (2 different URLs) and I’m trying to use the site search module on our landing pages so people can search events (outside of the blog). However, it’s pulling results for the landing pages on that URL. They both have site results system pages set up… I was trying to figure out if you can filter the results by a specific blog (using the blog ID). Any suggestions?
:thinking_face:
you have to create a custom module (clone the native hs search module) and set hidden fields to your specific domain or blog

add to the search form:
```<input type="hidden" name="domain" value="<http://event.domain-name.com|event.domain-name.com>">```
Oh! I see now. Thank you so so much! I don’t know why I didn’t think of that… It was right in front of me the whole time :woman-facepalming: lol

If interested in voting on the <#CCQSQ2C6L|crankshaft> logo - we have a poll going on in the <#CCQSQ2C6L|crankshaft> channel!

FYI CrankShaft is aiming to be a framework for building HubSpot sites, comparable to bootstrap/foundation/timber etc. but completely built from the ground up to use all the power that HubSpot provides to build high quality, fast, HubSpot sites.
<https://github.com/TheWebTech/CrankShaft>
